explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: It is a solid by the definition of GHS. However, since this product is liquefied at 30 - 31 degC, and the flash point is 43 - 93 degC and it is equivalent to the flammable liquid of "Category 3" or "Category 4" depending on storage conditions, precautions are required.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though "Flammble" (ICSC(J), 1995; etc.)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance contains P-O bonds as chemical groups with self-reactive properties present.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Although there was no data of firing point, it was judged that there was no spontaneous combustibility at normal temperature since the flash point was measured at normal temperature or higher temperatures (HSDB (2005), Gangolli (2nd, 1999)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test suitable for a liquid state substance (solid with a melting point of 140degC or less) has not been established.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Since aqueous solubility is measured (ICSC (1995), Merck (13th, 2001), Howard (1997)), it can be judged that it is stable in the water.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing oxygen bonded to phosphorus.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 5 based on SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE:2719mg/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: ACGIH (2001), PDS No.8 (1978)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on LD50 = 1082mg/kg calculated from four data (PATTY (5th, 2001), PDS No.8 (1978)) of rabbit LD50 values.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: There is only data LC50 >1.3mg/L in the study considered to be based on a dust. So it cannot be classified.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 3 based on the statement that mild irritation was seen in the animal (PATTY (5th, 2001), RTECS (2004)), and the statement that there was irritant by contact in humans (HSFS (2000)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the statement that there is slight irritation in animals, it was set as Category 2B.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: No data. Skin sensitization: We classified it as Out Of Category based on the statement that it had no skin sensitization property for the animals(PATTY (5th, 2001)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: It was considered as the outside of category based on the description that the effect is not observed on fertility property of parents and generating and growth of a child at the dose causing general toxicity to parents (ACGIH (2001), PDS No.8 (1978)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is a statement (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001)) that a organophosphate poisonings specific symptoms and cholinesterase inhibition are acknowledged by oral administration at the dosage of the guidance value range of Category 2 with rats and mice. In humans, there is a statement (HSDB (2005), SITTIG (47th, 2002)) that the symptoms of severe poisoning is developed by inhalations and contacts, and that headache, perspiration, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, coordinated movement loss, and death are seen by contact. It was set as Category 2 (nerve systems) based on the above information.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (nervous system) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: There is a statement that red blood cell cholinesterase inhibition in rats, mice, and dogs exposed to guidance value within the limits of Category 1is observed, and that typical cholinergic organophosphate intoxication is observed in those exposed to guidance value within the limits of Category 2 (ACGIH (2001), PATTY (5th, 2001), PDS No.8 (1978)). In humans, it is stated that respiratory insufficiency, debility, and prick pain feeling and incoodination at arms and legs are observed, and that the effect of the cholinesterase inhibitor may be accumulated (HSFS (2000), SITTIG (47th, 2002)). It was classified into Category 1 (nerve systems) based on the above information.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data
